abstract: Mr. Pottasch led the team at BBDO that created  iconic Pepsi commercials in the 1960s and ’70s and became known as the “father of the Pepsi Generation.”
snippet: Mr. Pottasch led the team at BBDO that created  iconic Pepsi commercials in the 1960s and ’70s and became known as the “father of the Pepsi Generation.”
lead_paragraph: Alan M. Pottasch, who became known as the “father of the Pepsi Generation” for leading the team that devised exuberant commercials in the 1960s and ’70s that linked Pepsi-Cola to the likes of skydivers and skateboarders, died Friday in Los Angeles. He was 79 and lived in New Fairfield, Conn.

headline.main: Alan M. Pottasch, 79, Dies; Creator of ‘Pepsi Generation’
